snippet: The Federal Highway Administration said an analysis of 1,048 Trinity Industries guardrails across five states did not indicate they had been quietly changed to make them safer.
abstract: Federal Highway Administration and American Assn of State Highway and Transportation Officials jointly release survey of potentially dangerous guardrails, which analyzed 1,048 guardrails across five states; survey seems to confirm guardrail manufacturer Trinity Industries assertion that it only produced one version of guardrails; safety experts question survey's methodology.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: The Federal Highway Administration said an analysis of 1,048 Trinity Industries guardrails across five states did not indicate they had been quietly changed to make them safer.

headline.main: Federal Agency Finds No Evidence That Trinity Industries Altered Guardrail Design Again
headline.print_headline: No Evidence Guardrail Maker Altered Design Again, Agency Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Assn of State Highway and Transportation Officials
